title: Data Processing and Validation Workflow
description: The sketch illustrates a multi-step workflow system for defining, validating, and processing data. The upper half includes modules for defining and validating coverage, attributes, and hierarchical structures. The lower half visualizes the flow of data through various stages, marked by 'TAG' mechanisms leading to categorized 'AREA' and 'GROUP'. The bottom section denotes the configuration files in YAML format and their deployment status.
differences: Today's advanced data processing tools often involve more sophisticated user interfaces, automation through machine learning, and integration with cloud services, reducing the need for manual configuration and validation as depicted in the sketch.
insights: The sketch emphasizes the importance of manual input and oversight in data validation.
Hierarchical tree structures are used for data categorization.
YAML configuration files play a critical role in setting up the processing environment.
The depiction suggests a segmented approach with stages clearly defined for data processing.
Manual push-to-deployment steps indicate potential points for error or bottlenecks.
